items.message: Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea,  early tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible from 02:00am to 04:00am tomorrow, Wednesday 10th December. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning.  River levels may remain high over the next couple of days. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 11am tomorrow, Wednesday 10th December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message: The Yeo and Parrett rivers remain high following the overnight rain.  Further rainfall is forecast from the afternoon of 09/12/2025 and into Wednesday 10/12/2025 which will cause further flooding impacts and sustain this Alert. The rain will cause rivers to rise again and bring fresh flows down into the Moors. The current river level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 8.14m and falling. The current drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.07m and is stable. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and the road from Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are pumping when river levels allow. Avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 2:00PM on 10 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 09 December 2025 , as a lot of rain (25mm) fell over the last 24 hours. 
Flooding could affect land, fields, and roads at Cadnam, West Wellow, Landford and Ower from 10:00 this morning. Water levels will also be very high around, and affect, the mill building at East Wellow. Property flooding is not expected. Only a small amount of rain is forecast for the remainder of today (up to 10mm). River levels should peak around 18:00, before beginning to fall overnight tonight (09/12/2025). No further rain is forecast for Wednesday and Thursday, giving the river a chance to recover. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels , and will ensure the river is kept free of reported blockages. 
Consider activating any flood protection products you may have . Including pumps. 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 10 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

The Cuckmere River is rising following Tuesday morning's rain. From 14:00 09/12/2025 minor flood impacts could affect fields near Station Road and Church Road, Hellingly. From 19:00 09/12/2025 minimal flood impacts could affect fields near North Street and River Lane, Alfriston. Showers are possible Tuesday afternoon, but very little rain is forecast over the next five days. River levels should begin to fall by 20:00 09/12/2025 in Hellingly, and by 08:00 10/12/2025 in Alfriston. River levels are expected to peak a little lower than they were in recent days, and return nearer to a normal level by Thursday. We are  closely monitoring the situation. Don't put yourself or others at risk. Avoid roads that flood (Mill Ln Church Rd Hellingly, North St Alfriston). This message will be updated by 14:00 10/12/2025.

The River Tone at Currymoor Pumping Station is still high.  Further rainfall is forecast for the afternoon of 09/12/2025 and into Wednesday 10/12/2025.  This flood alert will remain out as rivers are expected  to rise in response to the rainfal.. The rain will cause rivers to rise again and bring fresh flows down into the Moors. Drier weather is forecast on Wednesday until Thursday evening. The current River Tone level at Currymoor pumping station is 7.45m and is steady. Water enters Currymoor via Hookbridge spillway if this level exceeds 7.45m. The current drain level at Currymoor pumping station is 4.80m and rising steadily. Cutts Road floods if this level is above 5.75m, and New Road floods if it is above 6.18m. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are pumping when river levels allow. Take care and avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 10 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Coastal areas of West Wittering to Medmerry
items.message:
High tides on Wednesday may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from Wednesday's early morning tide at 02:45 on 10/12/2025. 
The shingle beach has been impacted by high energy waves. The weather decreases tide table values by 0.01 m. Total forecast tide is 4.53 metres Chart Datum (1.79 mAOD) at Chichester Harbour. Strong South Westerly Force 6 wind. Strong winds and large waves may push the tide to the top of the beach at Bracklesham, with possibility of water flowing into ditches behind. Spray will affect beach top properties at the end of West Sands Lane and Medmerry. Wednesday's tide at 15:00 10/12/2025 is forecast to be 29 cm lower (1.5 mAOD). 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Don't put yourself or others at risk . Avoid Medmerry sea front at high tide. Stormy seas are dangerous. 
This message will be updated by 11:00PM on 10 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo from Sherborne to Yeovil
items.message: The recent heavy rain has passed through the area but the River Yeo is still high due to the very wet catchments and flows still coming down the river system. The River Yeo remains above the Warning level in this area. Flooding is still possible this evening and overnight, Tuesday 09 December 2025, and into early Wednesday. Locations at risk are near the River Yeo, with low lying land and roads most affected, particularly around South Street, Ludborne Road and Sherborne Sewage Treatment Works and the Mole Valley Farmers area on the Sherborne Road near Yeovil. Drier weather is forecast on Wednesday and Thursday, though another band of rain is forecast on Thursday night into early Friday, which may bring further impacts. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are checking defences and clearing bridges, culverts and screens. Move family, pets and cars to safety and turn off gas, electricity and water if it is safe to do so. Refer to the local authority website for road closures. This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 10 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Yeo, River Parrett , with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around the A37 south and A303 south west of Ilchester.
